timeline.bodyText: Why does this need to be part of the public API of MSAL?  Is there an objection to this being accessed via an internal or private method?
timeline.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText: CP and AuthApp has to call it. Currently they're using (local) ADAL to obtain Broker AT/RT, then pass it into WPJ's Join() operation as parameters.
replies.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText: @rpdome @shoatman We could do like we did for TSL APIs and hide it away.... There's an ITokenShare API that PublicClientApplication needs to be cast to before those methods can be used. I think exposing this method on PCA and not allowing non-broker apps to call it is going to be incredibly frustrating for those developers who have requested we expose RT in the past
replies.author: iambmelt

replies.bodyText: That's what I'm aiming for. IBrokerRefreshTokenAccessor = ITokenShare.
replies.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText: @rpdome Sounds just fine to me then 👍
replies.author: iambmelt

replies.bodyText: @iambmelt - One of the goals of our libraries is not to expose refresh tokens.  Anyone can access the refresh token if they really want to... but we don't want to make it easy.  Also, what will we do when we enable refresh token PoP?  Are we planning to allow them to export the private key as well?
replies.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText: @rpdome - I think we should have a quick meeting to discuss this in more detail.
replies.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText: @rpdome @shoatman Agree, let's sync on these points
replies.author: iambmelt

timeline.bodyText: Do we want to put this in something like com.microsoft.identity.client.internal.api ?
